titleInfo.title: A museum guide robot: Dealing with multiple participants in the real-world

name.namePart: Workshop "Robots in public spaces. Towards multi-party, short-term, dynamic human-robot interaction" at ICSR 2013

mods.abstract: Using video-recordings from a real-world eld trial of a mu-seum guide robot, we show how a robot's gaze influences the visitors' state of participation in group constellations. Then, we compare the robot's conduct to a human tour guide's gaze strategies. We argue that a robot system, to deal with real-world everyday situations, needs to be equipped with knowledge about interactional coordination, incremental processing and strategies for pro-actively shaping the users' conduct.
